title: Nottingham schoolgirl, 12, died in hospital after being found in a Nottingham property
text:
A Nottingham schoolgirl has passed away after being found in a Nottingham property and taken to hospital.

12-year-old Tasmia Haque died in hospital on Wednesday, after being found at a property in the city.

The year 8 pupil's death has been mourned by her religious community.

Jamia Masjid Sultania mosque posted on Facebook: 'She was always known to be a very polite, sweet and warm girl. Always smiling and full of life. She will be dearly missed by us all.'

The twelve year old was a pupil at Nottingham Academy based in the centre of the city

One member of the mosque, Waqas Tariq, posted:' Such a sad loss, may Allah grant her the highest rank in heaven.'

Detectives are investigating the as yet unexplained death but are not looking for anyone else in connection with the incident.

Detective Inspector Sam Austin, of Nottinghamshire Police, said: 'All of our thoughts and deepest sympathies are with Tasmia's family, friends and loved ones at this difficult time.'

Tasmia's mosque posted on Facebook the day after she was confirmed to have died, mourning the 'beautiful student'

Members of the schoolgirl's mosque have used the mosque's Facebook post to voice their condolences to the girl and her family

'A file is being prepared for the coroner. We are not looking for anyone else in relation to Tasmia's death.'

'This is an extremely sensitive case that has understandably provoked emotion and caused great sadness within the local community.'

'We would be very grateful if the family's privacy could be respected and we'd also ask social media users to be mindful of comments they are making at this extremely difficult time.'
description: A Nottingham schoolgirl has passed away after being found in a city property. Tasmia Haque, 12, died after being found and taken to hospital on Wednesday.
